definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The birth of Torch Festival stems from of the ancient Yi people's worshiping of fire.
sentences.chinese: 火把节的诞生始于彝族先民对火的崇拜。

sentences.english: Reflects the Torch Festival of Yi people in Yunnan defying brutal force for the struggle against the spirit of a happy life.
sentences.chinese: 反映了云南与对幸福生活的斗争精神暴力彝族火把节。

sentences.english: At last, it discussed the problems lying in the festival and tourism industry in Liangshan.
sentences.chinese: 火把节的开发对凉山旅游业的发展起到推动作用。

sentences.english: The Torch Festival is at night, so there are only some photos of views.
sentences.chinese: 因为火把节是在晚上，所以只有一些景色的照片。

sentences.english: Chapter four, the paper mainly discussed how to use torch festival to promote the tourism development in liangshan.
sentences.chinese: 第四章，分析如何利用火把节推动凉山旅游的发展。

sentences.english: Torch Festival of the Yi people has a long history and wide influence.
sentences.chinese: 彝族火把节影响广泛，历久不衰，家喻户晓。

sentences.english: Chapter two, the paper analyzed the Torch Festival's role to Liangshan's tourism development.
sentences.chinese: 其次，分析了火把节对凉山旅游业发展产生的作用。

sentences.english: Which following nationalities celebrate the Torch Festival?
sentences.chinese: 火把节是我国哪些少数民族的节日？

definition: Lhasa Shoton festival or yogurt banquet, from first of July of Tibetan calendar
Wa, Kawa or Va ethnic group of Myanmar, south China and southeast Asia
Jingpo ethnic group of Tibet and Yunnan
Third Month Fair, traditional festival of the Bai Nationality 白族[Bai2 zu2]
Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China
Jingpo ethnic group of Tibet and Yunnan
Eid al-Adha or Festival of the Sacrifice (Qurban), celebrated on the 10th day of the 12th month of the Islamic calendar
